columns.text: In this exercise, we will determine the APR and the EAR of the loan to finance 80% of the new warehouse cost if the loan's monthly payment is $16,500 and the cost of the new warehouse is $3,400,000.

We will consider the following details in solving the problem:

| Particulars               |            |
|---------------------------|------------|
| Cost of the new warehouse | $3,400,000 |
| Loan's monthly payment    | $16,500    |
| Loan's period             | 30 (years) |

First, we will calculate the loan's amount if it can finance 80% of the price of the new warehouse. We will consider the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Loan amount} &= \text{Price of the new warehouse}\times80\%
\end{aligned}$$

Let's now calculate the amount of the loan.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Loan amount} &= \$3,400,000\times80\%
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\$2,720,000}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the loan amount to cover 80% of the cost of the new warehouse is $2,720,000.
Next, considering the loan amount calculated from the previous step as the present value, let's compute the loan's nominal rate.

In calculating the rate, we will utilize the spreadsheet function RATE.

The rate function is a financial function that calculates the rate of a loan based on the period, present value, and periodic payment. The rate spreadsheet formula is as follows:

$$\begin{aligned}
RATE&=(nper,pmt,pv,[fv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$


Where:

$nper$, which refers to the period\
$pmt$, which means the constant payment\
$pv$, which represent the present value\
$fv$, the future value\
$type$, which indicates the basis of the calculation, either year-end or beginning of the year

Since the periodic payment is monthly, we will multiply the number of years of the loan by twelve to convert the period into a monthly value.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Loan amount} &= 30\times12
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{360}
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, as can be seen above, the period is 360.

Let's now determine the nominal rate of the loan using a spreadsheet.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/fd260dd2-5afc-4033-b462-88cb419d7422-1642944758942805.png)


Therefore, the nominal rate of the loan is 0.51%.
Next, based on the nominal rate from the previous calculation, we will identify the APR of the loan.

APR, the *Annual Percentage Rate* also referred to as the stated rate, is calculated by multiplying the nominal rate by the number of periods in a year, representing the annual rate a lender can quote its customer as prescribed by laws. Hence, the APR can be calculated using the as follows equation:


$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &= \text{Nominal Rate}\times12
\end{aligned}$$

Let's now calculate the APR of the loan.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{APR} &= 0.0051\times12
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf6.12\%}
\end{aligned}$$

**Based on our calculation, the APR or the annual percentage of the loan to finance the new warehouse is 6.12%.**

For the following requirement, we will determine the EAR of the loan.

The EAR or the Effective Annual Rate refers to a loan's annual interest rate after considering the nominal interest rate and the compounding of periods.

The EAR calculation considers the APR and the compounding period of a loan. Hence, we will consider the annual percentage rate we calculated from the previous steps. The EAR can be calculated using the following equation:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{APR}{m}\right)^m-1
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$EAR$, which means the effective annual rate\
$APR$, which refers to the annual percentage rate\
$m$, which refers to the compounding period
The period we will consider in calculating the effective annual rate is twelve since the annual percentage rate or APR is calculated on a monthly basis.

Let's now calculate the effective annual rate of the loan.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &=\left(1+\dfrac{0.0612}{12}\right)^{12}-1
\\[10pt]
&= 1.0629 -1
\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\bf6.29\%}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, the loan's effective annual rate or EAR is 6.29%.**
To conclude, after considering and calculating the amount of the loan and the nominal rate, we determined that the loan to purchase a new warehouse has an APR of 6.12% and EAR of 6.29%.
